questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection where there are no crosswalks?
options: The vehicle, but it should slow down
The pedestrian, always
The pedestrian, but only when a crosswalk is marked
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have right-of-way, even without marked crosswalks.

questions.question: You should signal continuously while turning because it:
options: Is illegal to turn off your signal before completing a turn
Lets other drivers know what you are doing
Is always dangerous to turn off your signal before completing a turn
questions.explanation: Keep your signal on throughout a turn so other drivers know your intentions and can react safely.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or higher.
options: 0.08% - Eight hundredths of one percent
0.10% - One tenth of one percent
0.05% - Five hundredths of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit is 0.08% for drivers 21 and over.

questions.question: You may legally block an intersection:
options: Under no circumstances
When you entered on a green light
During rush hour traffic
questions.explanation: Never block an intersection under any circumstances, even if you have a green light. Wait until you can clear it completely.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about double parking?
options: It is illegal under all circumstances
It is allowed if you wait in the vehicle
It is allowed if you are making a delivery
questions.explanation: Double parking is illegal under all circumstances. It blocks traffic and creates a safety hazard.

questions.question: Tailgating other drivers (driving too close to their rear bumper):
options: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry
Cannot result in a traffic citation
Reduces collisions by preventing you from being "cut off"
questions.explanation: Tailgating is dangerous, illegal, and can lead to road rage. It increases collision risk and can result in a traffic citation.

questions.question: Railroad crossing lights are flashing. You must:
options: Stop only if you see a train
Slow down
Stop, then proceed when safe
questions.explanation: Stop when signals flash, proceed when safe.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Drive in the right lane at all times
Stay in the right lane if you are driving slower than other traffic
Slower traffic has the right-of-way
questions.explanation: Slower traffic should use the right lane to allow faster traffic to pass.

questions.question: You can make a right turn at a red light, after checking for pedestrians and other traffic:
options: Only if there is a sign that says it is OK
At any time, as long as you slow down first
After you stop and there is no sign to prohibit the turn
questions.explanation: You may turn right on red after stopping, unless a sign prohibits it. Always yield to pedestrians and traffic.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
DMV
Your automobile club
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: You should use your horn when:
options: Another driver makes a mistake
You may be in danger
Another vehicle is in your way
questions.explanation: Use your horn only when necessary to avoid a collision or warn others of danger.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking drugs?
options: Most drugs taken for headaches or colds can make a person drowsy
Drugs and alcohol can be used at the same time
Prescription drugs are safe to take at any time
questions.explanation: Many common medications can cause drowsiness and impair driving.

questions.question: A white painted curb means:
options: Loading zone for freight or passengers
Loading zone for passengers or mail only
No stopping or parking
questions.explanation: A white curb is for loading passengers or mail only.

questions.question: Which statement is true about motorcyclists and motorists?
options: Motorcyclists are not allowed to drive faster than other traffic during congested road conditions
Motorcyclists have the same rights/responsibilities as other motorists
Motorcycles are heavier than other vehicles and are less affected by wind or rain
questions.explanation: Motorcyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as other drivers. They are entitled to a full lane and must follow all traffic laws.

questions.question: If you become sleepy while driving, it is best to
options: Increase your speed to get away from other vehicles
Move over to the right lane and continue driving
Drive to a safe place, stop and rest
questions.explanation: Pull over and rest if you feel sleepy while driving.

questions.question: Drivers are required to obey instruction from:
options: Security guards patrolling parking lots
Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway
Flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites
questions.explanation: California law requires drivers to obey flaggers at construction sites. They have the authority to direct traffic for safety.

questions.question: You must use your seat belt:
options: Unless you are riding in the back of a pickup/camper
Unless you are driving in a private parking lot
Whenever you are driving a motor vehicle
questions.explanation: California law requires seat belt use whenever you are driving or riding in a motor vehicle, regardless of location.

questions.question: A triangular orange sign on the back of a slow-moving vehicle indicates that the vehicle is traveling at:
options: Less than 25 mph
Less than 35 mph
Less than 45 mph
questions.explanation: The orange triangle indicates a slow-moving vehicle traveling at less than 25 mph.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection where there are no crosswalks?
options: The vehicle, but it should slow down
The pedestrian, always
The pedestrian, but only when a crosswalk is marked
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way, even outside marked crosswalks.

questions.question: A car suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. Which of the following actions should you NOT take?
options: Honk and step on the brake firmly
Take your foot off the gas
Swerve into the lane next to you
questions.explanation: When a car cuts in front of you, take your foot off the gas to create space. Avoid sudden swerving which could cause a collision.

questions.question: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:
options: Continue at normal speed, but watch for pedestrians crossing
Stop and yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection
Slow down and be especially alert
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means caution. Slow down and proceed carefully through the intersection.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your automobile club
Your insurance company
DMV
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: A driver unexpectedly pulls in front of you. The handbook recommends:
options: Swerving into the lane next to you
Driving onto the shoulder of the road
Taking your foot off the gas pedal
questions.explanation: When another driver cuts in front of you, take your foot off the gas to slow down and increase following distance. Avoid sudden swerving.

questions.question: The speed limit for a school zone where children are present is _____ unless otherwise posted.
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a school zone when children are present is 25 mph unless a different speed is posted.

questions.question: A car is coming towards you in a residential area. Both of you will pass a parked car at the same time. You should steer:
options: Closer to the oncoming car than the parked car
Closer to the parked car than the oncoming car
A middle course between the oncoming and parked cars
questions.explanation: When passing a parked vehicle with oncoming traffic, stay closer to the parked car. The oncoming vehicle needs space to avoid the parked car too.

questions.question: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:
options: You should treat the signal like a stop sign
Stop, yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection
Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means caution. Slow down and proceed carefully through the intersection.

questions.question: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?
options: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop
Stop, then proceed when safe
Change lanes, look carefully, and pass
questions.explanation: When a vehicle ahead stops at a crosswalk, stop behind it. There may be a pedestrian crossing that you cannot see. Proceed only when it is safe.

questions.question: Which statement is not true about road workers?
options: Fines are doubled in construction zones
White signs tell of closed lanes
Equipment is painted orange
questions.explanation: Orange signs indicate construction, not white signs.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about roadways on bridges and overpasses in cold, wet weather?
options: They tend to freeze before the rest of the road does
They do not freeze because they are made of concrete
They tend to freeze after the rest of the road does
questions.explanation: Bridges and overpasses freeze before regular roadways because cold air surrounds them from above and below. Use extra caution in cold weather.

questions.question: If you have an accident and there is an injury, death, or more than $500 in damages, you must notify law enforcement and make a written report (SR 1) to:
options: Your insurance company
The CHP
The DMV
questions.explanation: If an accident involves injury, death, or over $500 in damage, you must file an SR-1 report with the DMV within 10 days.

questions.question: When a school bus with flashing red lights has stopped on the road ahead of you, you must
options: Slow to 10 m.p.h.
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Change lanes and pass cautiously
questions.explanation: Always stop when a school bus has flashing red lights.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Road closed to all traffic
You cannot enter from your direction
Do not enter unless safe
questions.explanation: 'Do Not Enter' prohibits entry from your direction.

questions.question: A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You should:
options: Stop, then proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus
Slow to 25 MPH and pass cautiously
Stop as long as the red lights are flashing
questions.explanation: You must stop and remain stopped as long as the red lights on the school bus are flashing.

questions.question: Yellow lines separate:
options: Traffic lanes on one-way streets
Traffic moving in opposite directions on a two-way road
All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. White lines separate traffic moving in the same direction.

questions.question: When can you merge into a bike lane for a right turn?
options: Under no circumstances
No more than 100 feet before turning
No more than 200 feet before turning
questions.explanation: Enter bike lanes no more than 200 feet before turning right.

questions.question: At an uncontrolled intersection where you can't see cross traffic until you're just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:
options: 25 mph
15 mph
10 mph
questions.explanation: At a blind intersection where you cannot see 100 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

questions.question: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before you cross the railroad tracks when:
options: You don't have room to completely cross the tracks
The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic
You transport two or more children in a passenger vehicle
questions.explanation: Never stop on railroad tracks. Only cross if you have enough space to completely clear the tracks on the other side.

questions.question: After passing another car, it is safe to return to the driving lane when:
options: The driver you just passed signals you to return to the lane
You look over your shoulder and see the car is behind you
You can see both headlights of the passed car in your rearview mirror
questions.explanation: It's safe to return to your lane when you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead is closed to traffic
You cannot enter the road from your direction
Do not enter unless it is safe
questions.explanation: 'Do Not Enter' means you cannot enter from your direction.

questions.question: Park downhill, no curb - turn wheels:
options: Toward center
Toward side of road
Parallel
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the roadside.

questions.question: To be sure a lane is clear before moving into it, you should
options: Turn your head and look
Look in the left side mirror
Look into the rear-view mirror
questions.explanation: Turn your head and look to check blind spots before changing lanes.

questions.question: Signal for a turn during the last ___ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning in residential/business areas.

questions.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:
options: Under no circumstances
If you don't feel drowsy
If it is prescribed by a physician
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely, including prescription and over-the-counter medications.

questions.question: What is the Basic Speed Law?
options: Keeping up with traffic flow
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
Never drive faster than posted limits
questions.explanation: The Basic Speed Law requires driving at a safe speed for conditions.

questions.question: You hit a parked car and can't find the owner. What must you do?
options: Call your insurance company when you get home
Wait for the owner to return
Leave a note on the other car
questions.explanation: If you hit a parked car, you must leave a note with your contact information.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions
You cannot enter the road from your direction
Do not enter unless it is safe
questions.explanation: 'Do Not Enter' sign means you cannot enter from your direction.

questions.question: Why should your passengers wear a seat belt?
options: It's the law
It helps prevent accidents
Passengers are not required to wear seat belts
questions.explanation: California law requires all vehicle occupants to wear seat belts.

questions.question: You must notify law enforcement and make a written report of a traffic accident when:
options: Your vehicle fails the smog test
You change your insurance company
Someone is injured or killed
questions.explanation: You must report accidents involving injury, death, or property damage over $1,000.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:
options: Closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle
Farther behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle
To the right side of the truck and wait to pass
questions.explanation: Large trucks require more following distance. Stay farther back to maintain visibility and give yourself more time to react.

questions.question: You should not drive
options: After you have taken any drink, drug, or medication which changes how you think, or act, or causes you to be less careful
If you are not alert
Both of the above
questions.explanation: Never drive impaired or when not alert.

questions.question: You want to back out of an angle parking space. You should always back slowly and:
options: Look at your rear view mirror
Have someone outside of the vehicle direct you
Look over your right shoulder
questions.explanation: When backing out of a parking space, turn and look over your right shoulder. Mirrors have blind spots and cannot show everything behind your vehicle.

questions.question: You want to turn left from a driveway. The road you want to turn onto has a lane marked as shown in the picture. You:
options: May turn into this lane before merging into regular traffic
Must use this lane before merging into regular traffic
May not turn into this lane while making your left turn
questions.explanation: Center left-turn lanes must be used when turning left from a driveway. Enter the lane, then merge when safe.

questions.question: When can you cross a solid double yellow line to pass another vehicle?
options: When you know there are no cars coming towards you
When a slow moving vehicle refuses to use a turn-out lane
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: Never cross double solid yellow lines - passing is prohibited.

questions.question: You can make a right turn at a red light, after checking for pedestrians and other traffic:
options: Only if there is a sign that says it is OK
At any time, as long as you slow down first
After you stop and there is no sign to prohibit the turn
questions.explanation: Right turns on red are allowed after stopping, unless a sign prohibits it.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
options: Parking is for emergency vehicles only
Stopping or parking is not allowed (except buses)
Parking is for disabled persons only
questions.explanation: Red curbs mean no stopping or parking, except buses at marked stops.

questions.question: Driving under the influence of any drug which makes you drive unsafely is
options: Permitted if it is prescribed by a doctor
Against the law
Permitted if it is a diet pill or cold medicine
questions.explanation: Driving impaired by any drug is illegal, even prescription drugs.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
options: Parking is for emergency vehicles only
Parking is for disabled persons only
Stopping or parking is not allowed (except buses)
questions.explanation: A red curb means no stopping, standing, or parking. Buses may stop at red zones marked for bus stops.

questions.question: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the 'Don't Walk' signal starts to flash. The person is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:
options: Proceed, but carefully drive around the person
Proceed if the person is not in your lane
Wait until the person crosses the street
questions.explanation: Always yield to pedestrians in the intersection, even if your light turns green. Wait until they have safely crossed.

questions.question: What is the Basic Speed Law?
options: Keeping up with the flow of traffic
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
Never drive faster than posted speed limits
questions.explanation: The Basic Speed Law requires driving at a safe speed for conditions, regardless of posted limits.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Right lane ends ahead
No right turn
Side road on the right
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead and traffic must merge left.

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must
options: Slow down because the road ends
Be prepared for workers and slow moving equipment
Change lanes and maintain speed
questions.explanation: Orange signs warn of construction zones with workers and equipment.

questions.question: Coasting with the gear shift in neutral is:
options: Recommended in the mountains
Safe and conserves gas
Against the law
questions.explanation: Coasting in neutral is illegal as it reduces vehicle control.

questions.question: Rear-ended someone - you were probably:
options: Weaving in traffic
Following too closely
Looking in mirror
questions.explanation: Rear-ends usually result from tailgating.

questions.question: The speed limit in a residential area is ___ unless otherwise posted.
options: 35 mph
25 mph
28 mph
questions.explanation: The default speed limit in residential areas is 25 mph.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
options: They take longer to come to a complete stop
They all have air brakes which allow them to stop quickly
They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles
questions.explanation: Large trucks require much more distance to stop than passenger vehicles due to their size and weight.

questions.question: A person may legally ride in the back of a pickup truck when the:
options: Pickup bed has a seat bolted to the frame
Back of the pickup is equipped with a restraint (seat belt) system
questions.explanation: California law requires anyone riding in the back of a pickup to use a properly installed restraint system.

questions.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:
options: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible
Assert your right-of-way by driving faster
Always slow down and maintain your position
questions.explanation: Be courteous and make room for merging traffic when safe. Change lanes or adjust speed if possible to allow smooth merging.

questions.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must:
options: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
Always drive at the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: The Basic Speed Law requires you to drive at a speed that is reasonable and safe for current conditions, regardless of the posted limit.

questions.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:
options: The light is yellow
The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first
You can't get all the way across before the light turns red
questions.explanation: Never enter an intersection unless you can completely clear it.

questions.question: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:
options: If the vehicle ahead is turning left
If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: You must never drive off the paved roadway to pass another vehicle. This is illegal and dangerous.

questions.question: You are driving up to a corner with a flashing yellow signal light. What should you do?
options: Wait for the green light before entering
Slow down and cross carefully
questions.explanation: Flashing yellow means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: This lane is used to:
options: Pass other vehicles when traffic permits
Make right turns when traffic permits
Begin or end left turns when traffic permits
questions.explanation: Center left-turn lanes are for beginning or ending left turns only, not for passing.

questions.question: You are driving 55 mph on a two lane road and want to pass the car ahead of you. To pass safely, you need a ___ gap in the oncoming traffic.
options: 5 second
7 second
10 to 12 second
questions.explanation: At 55 mph, you need at least a 10-12 second gap in oncoming traffic to pass safely on a two-lane road.

questions.question: You may cross over a double line on the road to pass another vehicle if the line on your side of the road is
options: Broken
Solid white
Solid yellow
questions.explanation: You can cross if the line on your side is broken.

questions.question: You can make a right turn at a red light, after checking for pedestrians and other traffic:
options: Only if there is a sign that says it is OK
At any time, as long as you slow down first
After you stop and there is no sign to prohibit the turn
questions.explanation: Right turn on red is allowed after stopping, unless prohibited by a sign.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead has many curves
There is a sharp curve in the road ahead
The road ahead may be slippery
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates slippery conditions ahead. Drivers should reduce speed and use caution.

questions.question: A flashing red light at an intersection means:
options: Slow down before entering
Stop before entering
Stop and wait for the green light
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means the same as a stop sign. Stop completely, yield to traffic and pedestrians, then proceed when safe.

questions.question: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:
options: Move toward the left side of your lane
Avoid driving in the bicycle lane
Signal for 100 feet before turning
questions.explanation: You must signal for at least 100 feet before turning.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions
You cannot enter the road from your direction
Do not enter unless it is safe
questions.explanation: This 'Do Not Enter' sign means you cannot enter from your direction - it's a one-way street or wrong way.

questions.question: Where should you stop your vehicle when there is no limit line?
options: Out far enough to see cross traffic
At the corner
After the crosswalk
questions.explanation: Stop where you have a clear view of cross traffic before entering the intersection.

questions.question: A curb painted blue means:
options: Loading or unloading passengers only
Parking for a limited time
Parking for a disabled person with a placard
questions.explanation: Blue curbs are reserved for disabled parking with a valid placard or license plate.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing. The lights are flashing red. You must:
options: Slow down before crossing
Stop, then proceed when safe
Stop only if you see a train coming
questions.explanation: Stop when signals flash. Proceed only when signals stop and it's safe.

questions.question: When is it legal to drive faster than the posted speed limit?
options: Never
When passing another vehicle
When everyone else is driving faster than the speed limit
questions.explanation: It is never legal to drive faster than the posted speed limit.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Side road ahead
Another lane is merging with yours
You have the right-of-way
questions.explanation: This sign warns that another lane is merging with your lane.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about driving speed?
options: There is no minimum speed law in California
The faster the speed, the less control you have of your vehicle
When you drive twice as fast, it takes twice the distance to stop
questions.explanation: Higher speeds reduce your control and dramatically increase stopping distance. Doubling speed quadruples stopping distance.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking drugs?
options: Most drugs taken for headaches or colds can make a person drowsy
Drugs and alcohol can be used at the same time
Prescription drugs are safe to take at any time
questions.explanation: Many medications can cause drowsiness and impair driving ability.

questions.question: You are approaching a green traffic light, but traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?
options: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way
Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across
Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear
questions.explanation: Never enter an intersection unless you can completely cross it. Wait even if you have a green light.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Vehicle has the right-of-way
Slow moving vehicle
Yield to the vehicle
questions.explanation: This triangle sign indicates a slow-moving vehicle (traveling under 25 mph).

questions.question: A person can ride in the back of a pick up truck when the:
options: Pickup bed has a seat bolted to the frame
Back of the pickup is equipped with a restraint (seat belt) system
Sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high
questions.explanation: California law requires that anyone riding in the back of a pickup truck must use a restraint system (seat belt) that is properly installed.

questions.question: An octagonal (8-sided) red sign always means:
options: Yield
Stop
Do not enter
questions.explanation: An octagonal red sign is always a STOP sign.

questions.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if:
options: A sign permits the turn
Traffic on the street moves to the right
Traffic on the street moves to the left
questions.explanation: You may turn left onto a one-way street only if traffic on that street moves to the left.

questions.question: Three of the most important times to check traffic behind you are before:
options: Backing, making a sharp turn, or crossing an intersection
Backing, changing lanes, or slowing down quickly
Changing lanes, crossing an intersection, or slowing down quickly
questions.explanation: Always check behind you before backing, changing lanes, or slowing down quickly to avoid rear-end collisions.

questions.question: A curb painted blue means:
options: Temporary parking is allowed if you wait in the car
Parking is allowed for disabled persons without a placard
Parking is for disabled persons with a placard
questions.explanation: A blue curb designates parking for disabled persons with a valid disabled person placard or license plate.

questions.question: There is a railroad crossing ahead and you see flashing red lights. You must:
options: Stop only if you see a train
Slow down before crossing
Stop, then proceed when safe
questions.explanation: Stop when signals flash, proceed only when safe.

questions.question: A yellow diamond-shaped sign with a black 'X' and two R's indicates:
options: Railroad crossing ahead
Rest area ahead
Road closed
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond with an X and two R's warns of a railroad crossing ahead.

questions.question: Which of these statements is not true about road workers?
options: Fines are doubled for some violations committed in construction zones
White signs tell you of closed lanes and road work ahead
Road working equipment is painted orange
questions.explanation: Orange signs (not white) indicate construction zones and road work ahead. White signs are regulatory.

questions.question: You may drive in a bike lane:
options: During rush hour traffic if bicycles are not present
No more than 200 feet before making a right turn
Whenever bicyclists are not present
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before making a right turn. Always check for bicyclists first.

questions.question: You want to park downhill and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
options: Parallel to the road
Towards the center of the road
Towards the side of the road
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the side when parking downhill without a curb.

questions.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your wheels?
options: So they face straight ahead
Right - towards side of the road
Left - towards the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking uphill with no curb, turn wheels to the right. If the vehicle rolls, it will go off the road rather than into traffic.

questions.question: If you sell your vehicle, you must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
Your bank or credit union
The DMV
questions.explanation: When you sell your vehicle, you must notify the DMV within 5 days to protect yourself from liability for any tickets or accidents involving the vehicle after the sale.

questions.question: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?
options: Into the curb
Away from the curb
Parallel to the curb
questions.explanation: When parking downhill, turn your wheels toward the curb so the curb will stop the car if it rolls.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Do NOT pass unless you do not see oncoming vehicles
Don't pass unless it seems safe to do so
Don't pass other vehicles for any reason
questions.explanation: A 'Do Not Pass' sign indicates it's unsafe to pass in that area. Only pass when it's clearly safe and legal.

questions.question: Signal for a turn during the last _____ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: You must signal for at least 100 feet before making a turn in a residential or business district, and at least 200 feet on a highway or freeway.

questions.question: Following distance should increase when you:
options: Follow a small passenger car
Are crowded by a tailgater
Drive slower than posted speed
questions.explanation: Increase following distance when being tailgated.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your automobile club
Your insurance company
DMV
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle to avoid liability.

questions.question: Checking traffic behind you:
options: Will help you know if you are being followed by a tailgater
Is not a good idea
Only when you are slowing down
questions.explanation: Check mirrors regularly to be aware of tailgaters and traffic behind.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway. Your tire suddenly goes flat and you need to pull over and get help. Where should you pull over?
options: In the right-hand lane
Wherever your car will be visible for 200 feet from the front
Off the pavement
questions.explanation: When you have vehicle trouble on a highway, pull completely off the pavement onto the shoulder for safety. This keeps you out of traffic lanes.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?
options: If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react
There is none, other drivers just crowd in front of you
You don't have to worry about the driver next to you
questions.explanation: Maintaining space around your vehicle gives you time to react if another driver makes a mistake, helping prevent collisions.

questions.question: At an intersection with stop signs at all four (or more) corners, when two cars arrive at the same time you must yield the right-of way to the driver
options: On your right
On your left
Signaling a turn
questions.explanation: Yield to the driver on your right at 4-way stops.

questions.question: Illegal BAC for 21+ drivers is ___ or more.
questions.explanation: Legal limit is 0.08% for drivers 21+.

questions.question: Pedestrians using guide dogs or carrying white canes must be
options: Given the right-of-way at all times
Given the right-of-way at corners only
Told when to cross the street
questions.explanation: Pedestrians with guide dogs or white canes always have right-of-way.

questions.question: To turn left from a one-way street into a one-way street, use:
options: The lane closest to the left curb
The center left-turn lane
Any lane as long as it is safe
questions.explanation: Turn left from the far left lane when both streets are one-way.

questions.question: You reach the intersection at the same time as the driver on your left. Who goes first?
options: The driver on your left goes first
You go first
Whoever is signaling to make a turn
questions.explanation: The vehicle on the right has right-of-way when arriving simultaneously.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is _____ or more.
options: One tenth (0.10) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
Five hundredths (0.05) of one percent
questions.explanation: In California, it is illegal for drivers 21 and over to drive with a BAC of 0.08% or higher. This is the legal limit for DUI.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
options: Not allowed (except buses may stop)
Allowed for a disabled vehicle only
For emergency vehicles only
questions.explanation: A red curb means no stopping, standing, or parking. Buses may stop at red zones marked for bus stops.

questions.question: You are repeatedly convicted of traffic violations. What can happen?
options: DMV may suspend your driving privilege
DMV may revoke your insurance
DMV will suspend the registration of your vehicle
questions.explanation: Repeated traffic violations can result in DMV suspending or revoking your driving privilege. You may be required to attend traffic school.

questions.question: To help avoid being hit from the rear by another driver when preparing to turn, you should
options: Keep parking lights on at all times
Signal at least 100 feet before you turn
Check your rearview mirror often
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning to warn drivers behind you.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle parallel to a curb on a level street:
options: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street
Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb
One of your rear wheels must touch the curb
questions.explanation: When parallel parking, your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.

questions.question: When driving on a multilane street with other vehicles:
options: You should drive alongside so the drivers can see you
You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles
It is safest to drive in the lane next to the center line
questions.explanation: Avoid driving in another vehicle's blind spot. Drive ahead or behind other vehicles to maintain visibility and safety.

questions.question: To turn left from a one-way street with multiple lanes onto a two-way street, start the turn in:
options: The far left lane
Any lane available
The lane closest to the middle of the street
questions.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street, begin the turn from the far left lane to ensure a safe and legal turn.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
options: Trucks are not as maneuverable as passenger vehicles
They do not need more space to stop and start
They do not need more space for turns
questions.explanation: Large trucks are much less maneuverable than passenger vehicles. They need more space to stop, start, and make turns. Always give trucks plenty of room.

questions.question: Signal for a turn during the last ___ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning in business or residential areas.

questions.question: If you get sleepy while driving, you should:
options: Drive to a safe place, stop, and rest
Turn the radio up and roll down the windows
Drink coffee to make you more alert
questions.explanation: The only safe remedy for drowsiness is to stop driving and rest. Rolling down windows or drinking coffee are not reliable solutions.

questions.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces you should:
options: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill
Drive on leaves or gravel in the road, if possible
Slow down for curves and intersections
questions.explanation: To avoid skidding, slow down before curves and intersections. Sudden braking or acceleration on slippery surfaces causes skids.

questions.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
options: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding
Cautiously drive around the pedestrian
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way, even outside of marked crosswalks. You must stop and let them cross safely.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?
options: Drinking coffee just before driving helps get rid of alcohol
If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired
Alcohol affects judgment and self control, needed for driving safely
questions.explanation: Alcohol impairs judgment and self-control essential for safe driving. Coffee does not eliminate alcohol from your system.

questions.question: Carpool lanes are marked with a diamond symbol. To use these lanes during the special hours shown on the signs you must
options: Be driving a van or bus
Drive at the speed limit or have your lights on
Have the minimum number of passengers shown on the signs
questions.explanation: Must have minimum number of passengers indicated on carpool signs.

questions.question: If you get drowsy while driving and refuse to take a test of your blood alcohol concentration (BAC):
options: Your license will be suspended for at least one year
You will not be forced to have blood drawn
You have the right to speak to a lawyer before taking the test
questions.explanation: Refusing a BAC test results in automatic license suspension for at least one year under California's implied consent law.

questions.question: If you are involved in an accident
options: Notify the local law enforcement agency or CHP if anyone is injured or killed
Show evidence that you have insurance only to a peace officer
Stop and identify yourself only if someone is injured
questions.explanation: Notify law enforcement if anyone is injured or killed in accident.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: You cannot turn left
You cannot make a U-turn
You cannot enter the side road
questions.explanation: This regulatory sign prohibits U-turns. You must go straight or turn right at this intersection.

questions.question: To turn left from a one-way street with multiple lanes onto a two-way street, start the turn in:
options: The far left lane
Any lane available
The lane closest to the middle of the street
questions.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street, begin the turn from the far left lane to ensure a safe and legal turn.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Stop every time
Stop two feet before the limit line
Stop only if other vehicles are present
questions.explanation: A STOP sign requires a complete stop every time, regardless of other traffic.

questions.question: Where should you stop when there is no limit line?
options: Out far enough to see cross traffic
At the corner
After the crosswalk
questions.explanation: Stop where you have clear view of cross traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?
options: Signaling at least 100 feet before turning
Keeping your parking lights on at all times
Using your emergency flashers at least 200 feet before turning
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning to warn traffic behind you.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a BAC that is ___ or more.
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21+ is 0.08%.

questions.question: You should use a turnout lane when:
options: You want to pass another driver
You want to make a U-turn
Faster drivers want to pass you
questions.explanation: Turnout lanes are designated areas where slower-moving vehicles can pull over to allow faster traffic to pass safely.

questions.question: During freezing weather, which area is most likely to be slippery after it snows or rains?
options: The tops of hills
Roadways in shady areas
Areas paved with asphalt rather than concrete
questions.explanation: Shaded areas freeze first and stay frozen longer because they receive less sunlight. Be extra cautious in these areas.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Side road ahead
Another lane merging with your lane
You have the right-of-way
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a side road ahead on the right.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing. The lights are flashing red. You must:
options: Slow down before crossing
Stop, then proceed when safe
Stop only if you see a train coming
questions.explanation: Stop when railroad signals flash. Proceed only when signals stop and it's safe.

questions.question: When a school bus with its red lights flashing is stopped ahead on your side of the road, you must:
options: Stop until you think all children are unloaded
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass cautiously
questions.explanation: When a school bus has red lights flashing, you must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing.

questions.question: If a driver ahead of you has stopped at a crosswalk, you should
options: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass
Tap your horn to let the driver know you are waiting
Stop then proceed when safe
questions.explanation: Stop behind vehicles stopped at crosswalks for pedestrians.

questions.question: A safety zone is a specially marked area for passengers to get on or off buses or trolleys. You may not drive through a safety zone:
options: Until all passengers have reached the sidewalk
Only when a bus or trolley is unloading passengers
At any time or for any reason
questions.explanation: A safety zone is a marked area for pedestrians. Never drive through or park in a safety zone under any circumstances.

questions.question: Following distance should increase when you:
options: Follow a small passenger car
Are crowded by a tailgater
Drive slower than the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: When being tailgated, increase following distance for safety.

questions.question: You may drive in a bike lane:
options: If you drive slower than 15 mph
No more than 200 feet before making a right turn
Whenever bicyclists are not present
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before making a right turn. Always check for bicyclists first.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?
options: Other drivers crowd in front of you, improving traffic flow
If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react
It inflates to protect you from injury in case of an accident
questions.explanation: Maintaining space around your vehicle gives you time to react if another driver makes a mistake, helping prevent collisions.

questions.question: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?
options: The driver on your left has the right-of-way
You have the right-of-way
Whoever is signalling to make a turn has the right-of-way
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, when two vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way. Since the other driver is on your left, you have the right-of-way.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about light rail vehicles?
options: Light rail vehicles can interrupt traffic signals
You must always pass a light rail vehicle on the right
Light rail vehicles do not have the same responsibilities
questions.explanation: Light rail vehicles can preempt traffic signals and have priority.

questions.question: You reach an intersection at the same time as the driver on your left. Who goes first?
options: The driver on your left goes first
You go first
Whoever is signaling to make a turn
questions.explanation: When two vehicles arrive simultaneously at an intersection, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: When can you use only parking lights?
options: After sunset or before sunrise
Never
On foggy days
questions.explanation: Parking lights are never sufficient for driving.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or higher.
options: 0.08% - Eight hundredths of one percent
0.10% - One tenth of one percent
0.05% - Five hundredths of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over in California is 0.08%. Driving at or above this level is illegal.

questions.question: You can make a right turn at a red light, after checking for pedestrians and other traffic:
options: Only if there is a sign that says it is OK
At any time, as long as you slow down first
After you stop and there is no sign to prohibit the turn
questions.explanation: Right turn on red is allowed after stopping, unless prohibited by a sign.

questions.question: You must make a financial responsibility report after an accident when damage to one of the vehicles is over $750
options: Only if you are not insured
Only if it was your fault
No matter who was at fault
questions.explanation: File SR-1 report regardless of fault if damage exceeds threshold.

questions.question: You reach the intersection at the same time as the driver on your left. Who goes first?
options: The driver on your left goes first
You go first
Whoever is signaling to make a turn
questions.explanation: The vehicle on the right has right-of-way at uncontrolled intersections.

questions.question: You want to park downhill and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
options: Towards the center of the road
Towards the side of the road
Parallel to the road
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the side of the road so the vehicle rolls off the road if it moves.

questions.question: This lane is used to:
options: Pass other vehicles
Make right turns
Begin or end left turns
questions.explanation: Center lanes are for left turns only.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about double parking?
options: It is allowed if you are making a delivery
It is illegal under all circumstances
It is illegal unless you wait in the vehicle
questions.explanation: Double parking is illegal under all circumstances. It blocks traffic and creates a safety hazard.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or higher.
options: 0.08% - Eight hundredths of one percent
0.10% - One tenth of one percent
0.05% - Five hundredths of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over in California is 0.08%.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a safe driving habit?
options: Keep parking lights on at all times
Fix your eyes on the vehicle ahead
Turn your head and look before you turn the steering wheel
questions.explanation: Fixing your eyes on one vehicle reduces awareness of surroundings.

questions.question: Which of these is true about cold weather and driving conditions?
options: When the temperature drops, bridges freeze before open roads
Roads become more slippery as rain continues than when it begins
Driving conditions become more dangerous as the temperature rises above freezing
questions.explanation: Bridges and overpasses freeze before regular roadways because cold air surrounds them from above and below. Use extra caution in cold weather.

questions.question: A passenger vehicle may NOT tow
options: One trailer
Another passenger vehicle
Two trailers
questions.explanation: Passenger vehicles cannot tow two trailers at once.

questions.question: Why should your passengers wear a seat belt?
options: It's the law
It helps prevent accidents
Passengers are not required to wear seat belts
questions.explanation: California law requires all vehicle occupants to wear seat belts.

questions.question: When can you drive using only your parking lights?
options: 30 minutes after sunset or before sunrise
Not under any circumstances
On foggy days
questions.explanation: Parking lights are never sufficient for driving.

questions.question: You are about to make a left turn. You must signal continuously during the last ____ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: You must signal for at least the last 100 feet before making a turn.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway. Your tire suddenly goes flat and you need to pull over and get help. Where should you pull over?
options: In the right-hand lane
Wherever your car will be visible for 200 feet from the front
Off the pavement
questions.explanation: Pull completely off the pavement onto the shoulder for safety.

questions.question: If you are repeatedly convicted for traffic violations
options: DMV may impound your vehicle
Your driving privilege may be suspended by DMV
Both of the above
questions.explanation: Repeated violations can lead to license suspension.

questions.question: When coming to a corner where there is a stop sign, you must first stop
options: After crossing the crosswalk
Out far enough to see cross traffic
In back of the crosswalk
questions.explanation: Stop behind the crosswalk or limit line at stop signs.

questions.question: When can you merge into a bike lane for a right turn?
options: Under no circumstances
No more than 100 feet before turning
No more than 200 feet before turning
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

questions.question: To turn left from a one-way street into a one-way street, use:
options: The lane closest to the left curb
The center left-turn lane
Any lane as long as it is safe
questions.explanation: Turn left from the far left lane when both streets are one-way.

questions.question: You hit a parked car and can't find the owner. What must you do?
options: Call your insurance company when you get home
Wait for the owner to return
Leave a note on the other car
questions.explanation: Leave a note with your contact information if you hit a parked car.

questions.question: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:
options: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking traffic
Not turn in that direction until the light turns green
Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop
questions.explanation: A red arrow means you must not turn in that direction. Wait until the arrow turns green or disappears.

questions.question: Seat belts not effective when:
options: Over 40 mph
Always effective
At slow speeds
questions.explanation: Seat belts always effective.

questions.question: If you are arrested for drunk driving and refuse to submit to a chemical test of the alcohol content of your blood
options: Your driving privilege will be withdrawn
You will receive an additional fine
You will not be allowed to post bail
questions.explanation: Refusing BAC test results in automatic license suspension.

questions.question: You just rear-ended the car in front of you. You were probably:
options: Weaving in and out of traffic
Following too closely
Looking in your rear view mirror too often
questions.explanation: Rear-end collisions typically occur when following too closely (tailgating).

questions.question: You are passing a school and see children near the street. You may not drive faster than
questions.explanation: Maximum 25 mph in school zones when children are present.

questions.question: If you sell your vehicle, you must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
Your bank or credit union
The DMV
questions.explanation: You must notify the DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle to avoid liability for future tickets or accidents.

questions.question: Backing your vehicle is:
options: Always dangerous to do
Not dangerous if you have a helper
Only dangerous in large vehicles
questions.explanation: Backing is always dangerous because of limited visibility. Check all around your vehicle before backing and proceed slowly.

questions.question: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:
options: Drive alongside the other vehicles so the drivers can see you
You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles
It is safest to drive in the lane next to the center line
questions.explanation: Avoid driving in another vehicle's blind spot. Drive ahead or behind other vehicles to maintain visibility and safety.

questions.question: You are driving on a two-way street and you want to turn left at the corner. Give the right-of-way to:
options: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a 'WALK' signal
Any vehicle coming towards you
Vehicles stopped at a red light
questions.explanation: When turning left, yield to all oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Implied consent law means:
options: Vehicle inspection consent
Blood alcohol test consent
Field sobriety test consent
questions.explanation: Consent to BAC testing when driving.

questions.question: If you are involved in an accident, you must show your driver license and _____ to the other person(s) involved:
options: Proof of financial responsibility
Proof of financial responsibility and vehicle registration
Proof of financial responsibility, vehicle registration, and current address
questions.explanation: After an accident, you must exchange driver license, proof of financial responsibility (insurance), vehicle registration, and current address with other parties involved.

questions.question: When parking next to a curb, you should use your signals:
options: Only when pulling away from the curb
When pulling next to, but not away from, the curb
When pulling next to or away from the curb
questions.explanation: Always signal your intentions when parking or leaving a parking space. This alerts other drivers and prevents collisions.

questions.question: You are driving at night and using high beams. Dim your lights when you get closer than _____ feet from the car ahead.
questions.explanation: Dim your high beams to low beams when within 300 feet of an oncoming vehicle or when following within 300 feet of another vehicle.

questions.question: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:
options: The inside rearview mirror
The outside rearview mirror
Over your shoulder
questions.explanation: Mirrors cannot show your entire blind spot. You must physically turn and look over your shoulder before changing lanes.

questions.question: When can you merge into a bike lane for a right turn?
options: Under no circumstances
No more than 100 feet before turning
No more than 200 feet before turning
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about safety zones?
options: The road is probably being repaired by slow moving vehicles
If a street car is stopped at a safety zone controlled by a traffic signal, you can pass at 25 m.p.h.
It is a space set aside for pedestrians and marked by raised buttons or road markings
questions.explanation: A safety zone is a marked area for pedestrians, often at streetcar or transit stops. Never drive through or park in a safety zone.

questions.question: Checking traffic behind you:
options: Will help you know if you are being followed by a tailgater
Is not a good idea. You should pay attention to traffic in front
Only when you are slowing down
questions.explanation: Regularly check mirrors to be aware of traffic and tailgaters behind you.

questions.question: You exit a freeway and see that the off ramp curves down hill. You should:
options: Slow to a safe speed before the curve
Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking
Slow down as you approach curves and intersections
questions.explanation: Slow down before entering a curve, especially on a downhill off-ramp. Braking in a curve can cause loss of control.

questions.question: A person can ride in the back of a pick up truck when the:
options: Sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high
Pickup bed has a seat bolted to the frame
Back of the pickup is equipped with a restraint (seat belt) system
questions.explanation: Passengers in pickup beds must use a properly installed restraint system.

questions.question: When you approach a 'blind' intersection (you can't see 100 feet down the cross street) and there is no STOP or YIELD sign placed at the corner, the speed limit is
questions.explanation: Speed limit at blind intersections is 15 mph.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
options: Stopping or parking is not allowed (except buses)
Parking is for disabled persons only
Parking is for emergency vehicles only
questions.explanation: Red curbs prohibit stopping or parking (buses may stop at marked stops).

questions.question: You are almost through an intersection when you realize you want to turn left instead of going straight. What should you do now?
options: Stop in the intersection until it is safe to make the left turn
Continue to the next intersection and find a route to work your way back
Back up, check for other vehicles, and make the left turn
questions.explanation: If you miss your turn, continue to the next intersection. Never stop or back up in an intersection.

questions.question: Which of these is a legal U-turn?
options: On a highway where there is an opening for a turn
150 feet before a curve in the road
In front of a fire station
questions.explanation: U-turns are legal on highways at designated openings, but not near curves or emergency facilities.

questions.question: You should scan 10 to 15 seconds ahead of you:
options: To avoid using your side mirrors
Because it's a legal requirement
To see hazards early
questions.explanation: Scanning 10-15 seconds ahead helps you identify hazards early and react safely.

questions.question: Which of these is true about signal persons at road construction sites?
options: You must follow their instructions or you may see orange cones
You must follow their instructions on the road ahead is blocked
Their signals are simply suggestions at all times
questions.explanation: California law requires drivers to obey flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites. They have the authority to direct traffic for safety.

questions.question: You must always look carefully for motorcycles before you change lanes or make a left turn because they
options: Have the right-of-way
Are hard to see
Are driven too fast
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are smaller and harder to see in traffic.

questions.question: It is illegal to block an intersection:
options: Under any circumstances
Unless you have the right-of-way
Unless some of the cross traffic can get around you
questions.explanation: Never block an intersection under any circumstances.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Pedestrians must walk facing traffic
Pedestrians may walk in the street
There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead
questions.explanation: This yellow warning sign indicates a pedestrian crosswalk ahead. Drivers should be prepared to slow down or stop for pedestrians.

questions.question: If you become angry or upset, you should
options: Go for a drive to forget your problems
'Cool off' before driving
Control your emotions while driving
questions.explanation: Cool off before driving to avoid emotional driving.

questions.question: You are driving on a two-way street and you want to turn left at the corner. Give the right-of-way to:
options: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a 'WALK' signal
Any vehicle coming towards you
Vehicles stopped at a red light
questions.explanation: When turning left, yield to all oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: What is a safety zone?
options: An empty lane next to the freeway dividers
The median strip on a divided highway
A space set aside for pedestrians
questions.explanation: Safety zones are marked areas for pedestrians at transit stops.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about lap-only seat belts?
options: They are safer for young children than using shoulder-belts
They are safest when used in combination with a shoulder belt
Pregnant women should not wear them unless combined with a shoulder belt
questions.explanation: Lap belts are safest when used in combination with shoulder belts. California law requires all available seat belts to be used.

questions.question: Two sets of solid, double, yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:
options: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway
May not be crossed for any reason
Should be treated as a separate traffic lane
questions.explanation: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced 2 feet or more apart are considered a barrier. You may not cross them for any reason.

questions.question: When five or more vehicles are following you on a narrow two lane road, you should:
options: Continue driving and ignore them
Speed up when they try to pass you
Pull off the road when it is safe and let them pass
questions.explanation: If five or more vehicles are following you on a two-lane road, you must pull over when safe to let them pass.

questions.question: A yellow sign with a traffic signal symbol means:
options: Controlled railroad crossing ahead
Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing
There is a traffic signal ahead
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to stop if the light is red.

questions.question: If traffic light is red, but a police officer or fire fighter on duty tells you to go ahead, you should
options: Wait for the green light
Do as he or she tells you
Report him or her to police
questions.explanation: Officers directing traffic override traffic signals.

questions.question: You may not 'double park'
options: At any time
Except when making a delivery
Except while waiting in the vehicle
questions.explanation: Double parking is never allowed.

questions.question: What is Basic Speed Law?
options: Keep up with traffic
Never faster than safe for conditions
Never exceed posted limits
questions.explanation: Drive at safe speed for conditions.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The driver on the right goes first
All other drivers go first
Make a complete stop before turning
questions.explanation: The YIELD sign means you must slow down and give the right-of-way to other vehicles and pedestrians. You must be prepared to stop if necessary.

questions.question: When can you drive using only your parking lights?
options: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise
Under no circumstances
On foggy days when visibility is low
questions.explanation: Parking lights are not sufficient for driving. You must use headlights from sunset to sunrise and in poor visibility.

questions.question: Where to stop with no limit line?
options: Far enough to see cross traffic
At the corner
After crosswalk
questions.explanation: Stop where you can see cross traffic.

questions.question: The 'implied consent law' means you have given your consent:
options: To inspection of your vehicle for alcohol
To be tested for alcohol in your blood
For a field sobriety test
questions.explanation: By driving in California, you consent to BAC testing if suspected of DUI.

questions.question: The speed limit in a residential area is ___ unless otherwise posted.
questions.explanation: The default speed limit in residential areas is 25 mph.

questions.question: You can avoid skidding on a slippery surface by:
options: Shifting to a lower gear after you start down a steep hill
Following in the tracks of the vehicle in front of you
Slowing down as you approach curves and intersections
questions.explanation: To avoid skidding, slow down before curves and intersections. Sudden braking or acceleration on slippery surfaces can cause loss of control.

questions.question: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park uphill next to a curb?
options: Parallel to the curb
To the left—away from the curb
To the right—into the curb
questions.explanation: When parking uphill next to a curb, turn your wheels away from the curb (to the left). If the car rolls, it will roll into the curb and stop.

questions.question: When would you yield your legal right-of-way?
options: When it helps prevent collisions
When it helps prevent road rage
Never, it confuses other drivers
questions.explanation: Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent a collision, even if you legally have the right-of-way.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or more.
options: Five hundredths (0.05) of one percent
One tenth (0.10) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.

questions.question: You are driving up a corner with a flashing yellow signal light. What should you do?
options: Wait for the green light before entering
Slow down and cross carefully
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: You are on a two-way street with two lanes in each direction. To turn left, start the turn in:
options: Any lane open to you for traffic in your direction
The left lane for traffic in your direction
The right lane for traffic in your direction
questions.explanation: Always turn left from the left lane when there are multiple lanes in your direction. This ensures a safe and predictable turn.

questions.question: If a police officer asks you to take an alcohol test, you may choose:
options: A blood, breath, or urine test
A field sobriety test
To say the alphabet backwards
questions.explanation: You can choose blood, breath, or urine test for BAC testing.

questions.question: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:
options: Need to warn other drivers of an accident ahead
Are driving much slower than other traffic
Are backing out of a parking space
questions.explanation: Use your flashers or flash brake lights to warn drivers behind you of hazards or accidents ahead.

questions.question: You are driving 55 m.p.h. on a two lane road and want to pass the car ahead of you. To pass safely, you need a _____ gap in the oncoming traffic.
options: 5 second
7 second
10 to 12 second
questions.explanation: At 55 mph, you need at least a 10-12 second gap in oncoming traffic to pass safely. This allows enough time to complete the passing maneuver.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
DMV
Your automobile club
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?
options: Other drivers can "cut" in front of you, improving traffic flow
If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react
It inflates to protect you from injury in case of a collision
questions.explanation: A space cushion gives you time and space to react to unexpected situations, reducing your risk of a collision.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic light mean?
options: Stop if it is safe to do so
Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop, then proceed when safe
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: You cannot turn left
You cannot make a U-turn
You cannot enter the side road
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns at this location.

questions.question: It has been proven that safety belts:
options: Sometimes cause drivers to be trapped in their cars
Can make it harder to steer during an emergency
Can reduce injury and death
questions.explanation: Seat belts significantly reduce injury and death in accidents.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about blind spots?
options: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots
questions.explanation: Always look over the appropriate shoulder to check blind spots before changing lanes.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway. Your tire suddenly goes flat. Where should you pull over?
options: In the right-hand lane
Wherever your car will be visible for 200 feet
Off the pavement
questions.explanation: Pull completely off the pavement for safety.

questions.question: How many days do you have to report to DMV the sale or transfer of your vehicle?
options: 5 days
10 days
20 days
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling or transferring vehicle.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify _____ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
DMV
Your automobile club
questions.explanation: When you sell your vehicle, you must notify the DMV within 5 days to protect yourself from liability for any tickets or accidents involving the vehicle after the sale.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection where there are no crosswalks?
options: The vehicle, but it should slow down
The pedestrian, always
The pedestrian, but only when a crosswalk is marked
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have right-of-way, even without marked crosswalks.

questions.question: Backing your vehicle is:
options: Always dangerous to do
Dangerous if you have a helper
Only dangerous in large vehicles
questions.explanation: Backing is always dangerous because of limited visibility. Check all around your vehicle before backing and proceed slowly.

questions.question: There is a railroad crossing ahead. You see a mechanical signal warning you of an approaching train. You must:
options: Stop, then proceed when safe
Slow down before crossing
Stop only if you see a train coming
questions.explanation: When railroad crossing signals are flashing, you must stop at least 15 feet from the tracks. Proceed only when signals stop and it's safe.

questions.question: You are driving 55 mph in the far left (fast) lane of a freeway posted for 65 mph. You could be cited for driving too slowly:
options: If the road or weather conditions warrant driving this slowly
If you block the normal and reasonable flow of traffic
Under no circumstances because it is always safer to drive slower than other traffic
questions.explanation: Driving significantly slower than traffic flow, even under the speed limit, can be dangerous and is illegal if it blocks traffic.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. Notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your automobile club
Your insurance company
DMV
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of sale.

questions.question: If you sell your vehicle, you must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
Your bank or credit union
The DMV
questions.explanation: You must notify the DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: You want to park downhill and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your wheels?
options: Towards the center of the road
Towards the side of the road
Parallel to the road
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the side of the road.

questions.question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:
options: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane
Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal
Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed
questions.explanation: Never assume other drivers will cooperate. Always check that you have enough space to pass safely.

questions.question: While all of the following are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?
options: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones
Adjusting your outside mirrors
Reading a road map
questions.explanation: It is illegal in California to wear headphones covering both ears while driving, as it prevents you from hearing emergency vehicles and other important sounds.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway. Your tire suddenly goes flat and you need to pull over and get help. Where should you pull over?
options: In the right-hand lane
Wherever your car will be visible for 200 feet from the front
Off the pavement
questions.explanation: When you have vehicle trouble on a highway, pull completely off the pavement onto the shoulder for safety.

questions.question: You must not cross a solid double line in the center of the roadway to
options: Overtake and pass another vehicle
Make a left turn
Enter a private driveway
questions.explanation: Never cross double solid yellow lines to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: When you don't see any other vehicles around, you:
options: Only need to signal for a left or right turn
Should still always use your turn signals
Only need to signal when changing lanes
questions.explanation: Always use your turn signals regardless of whether you see other vehicles. There may be pedestrians, bicyclists, or vehicles you haven't noticed.

questions.question: You are driving alongside a bicycle lane and want to turn right at a corner. You should signal, look carefully for bike riders, then
options: Merge into the bike lane before turning
Make your turn, being careful to stay out of the bike lane
Speed up and pass any bicycle riders before they get to the corner
questions.explanation: Merge into bike lane before turning right (no more than 200 feet).

questions.question: Which of the following statement is true about light rail vehicles?
options: Light rail vehicles can interrupt traffic signals
You must always pass a light rail vehicle on the right
Light rail vehicles do not have the same responsibilities as other vehicles on public roadways
questions.explanation: Light rail vehicles can preempt traffic signals and have priority at intersections.

questions.question: You should check traffic behind you:
options: So you will know if you are being followed by a tailgater
Only on a freeway or highway
Only when you are slowing down
questions.explanation: Regularly check your mirrors to be aware of traffic behind you, including tailgaters. This helps you make safe decisions about lane changes, stops, and turns.

questions.question: A curb painted blue means:
options: Loading or unloading passengers only
Parking for a limited time
Parking for a disabled person with a placard
questions.explanation: Blue curbs are reserved for disabled parking with valid placard.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
options: Fog lights only
High beams
Low beams
questions.explanation: Use low beams in fog. High beams will reflect off the fog and make it harder to see.

questions.question: You are involved in a minor collision at an intersection. There are no injuries and very little vehicle damage. You should:
options: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives
Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible
Not move your vehicle for any reason
questions.explanation: California law requires you to move your vehicle out of traffic if there are no injuries and the vehicle is drivable. This helps prevent secondary collisions.

questions.question: If you have a conditional driver license, there is (are):
options: A special time limit to renew your license
Special restrictions you must follow when driving
Age limits imposed on your driver license
questions.explanation: A conditional driver license has specific restrictions you must follow, such as time limits or geographical restrictions. Violating these can result in suspension.

questions.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
options: In both directions may pass
Next to the broken line may pass
Next to the solid line may pass
questions.explanation: When there is a solid yellow line on your side, you cannot pass. Only vehicles on the side with the broken line may pass when safe.

questions.question: If you have a conditional driver license, there is (are):
options: A special time limit to renew your license
Special restrictions you must follow when driving
Age limits imposed on your driver license
questions.explanation: A conditional license has specific restrictions you must follow, such as time or geographical limits.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
DMV
Your automobile club
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling to avoid liability.
