questions.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 MPH. The traffic is traveling at 70 MPH. You may legally drive:
options: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph
questions.explanation: Even if traffic is moving faster, you should not exceed the posted speed limit.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about blind spots?
options: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots
questions.explanation: Look over the appropriate shoulder to check blind spots before lane changes.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Vehicle has the right-of-way
Slow moving vehicle
Yield to the vehicle
questions.explanation: This triangle indicates a slow-moving vehicle (under 25 mph).

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
options: Trucks are not as maneuverable as passenger vehicles
They do not need more space to stop and start
They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles
questions.explanation: Large trucks need more space and are less maneuverable than cars.

questions.question: You should avoid driving through deep puddles or flowing water. If you must drive through water, the California Driver Handbook recommends you try them by:
options: Driving at an increased accelerator at the same time
Alternately pressing the brake and gas pedals
Pressing the brake pedal hard for 3 or 4 seconds
questions.explanation: When driving through water, maintain steady accelerator pressure. After going through water, test your brakes to ensure they work properly.

questions.question: Using the unpaved shoulder of the road to pass to the right of a vehicle ahead of you is
options: Forbidden by law
Permitted if you are turning right
Permitted if the vehicle ahead is turning left
questions.explanation: Passing on unpaved shoulder is illegal.

questions.question: A yellow sign showing a car skidding means:
options: The road ahead has many curves
There is a sharp curve in the road ahead
The road ahead may be slippery
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates slippery conditions ahead. Drivers should reduce speed and use caution.

questions.question: Parking is NEVER permitted:
options: Twenty feet from a railroad track
In a crosshatched pattern space next to a disabled parking space
On a hill
questions.explanation: Never park in crosshatched areas next to disabled parking spaces. These areas are access aisles for wheelchair users.

questions.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection or crosswalk when
options: The light is yellow
The light is flashing red
You cannot cross without obstructing traffic from either side
questions.explanation: Never block an intersection even if you have a green light.

questions.question: Blocking an intersection during 'rush hour' traffic is not permitted:
options: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light
Under any circumstances, even if your light is green
Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light
questions.explanation: You must never block an intersection, even if you have a green light. Wait until traffic clears and you can completely cross the intersection.

questions.question: You just rear-ended the car in front of you. You were probably:
options: Weaving in and out of traffic
Following too closely
Looking in your mirror too often
questions.explanation: Rear-end collisions typically result from following too closely.

questions.question: A person can ride in the back of a pick up truck when the:
options: Sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high
Pickup bed has a seat bolted to the frame
Back of the pickup is equipped with a restraint (seat belt) system
questions.explanation: Passengers in pickup beds must use a properly installed restraint system.

questions.question: It is illegal to park your vehicle:
options: In an unmarked crosswalk
Within three feet of a private driveway
In a bicycle lane
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in a crosswalk, whether marked or unmarked.

questions.question: The law states that for an adult, you are legally drunk when your blood alcohol concentration reaches a minimum of
options: One hundredth (0.01) of one percent
One tenth (0.10) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.

questions.question: Which of these statements is not true about road workers?
options: Fines are doubled for some violations in construction zones
White signs tell you of closed lanes and road work ahead
Road working equipment is painted orange
questions.explanation: Orange signs (not white) indicate construction zones.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: U-turn area ahead
No U-turn
No passing
questions.explanation: This regulatory sign with a U-turn symbol and a red circle with a line through it means U-turns are prohibited in this area.

questions.question: When five or more vehicles are following you on a narrow two lane road, you should:
options: Continue driving and ignore them
Speed up when they try to pass you
Pull off the road when it is safe and let them pass
questions.explanation: Pull over when safe to let five or more vehicles pass on narrow roads.

questions.question: When a school bus with flashing red lights has stopped on the road ahead of you, you must
options: Slow to 10 m.p.h.
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Change lanes and pass cautiously
questions.explanation: Must stop when school bus lights are flashing red.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions
Do not enter the road from your direction
You cannot enter unless it is safe
questions.explanation: 'Do Not Enter' means you cannot enter from your direction.

questions.question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ___ days.
questions.explanation: You must notify the DMV within 5 days of selling or transferring your vehicle.

questions.question: When should a 3 year old weighing 45 lbs. be placed in a safety seat?
options: Under all circumstances
Only when driving on the freeway
Only if the child is in the front seat
questions.explanation: California law requires children under 8 years old OR under 4'9" tall to be properly secured in a child safety seat or booster seat in the back seat.

questions.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:
options: Under no circumstances
If you don't feel drowsy
If it is prescribed by a physician
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely, including prescription and over-the-counter medications.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions
You cannot enter the road from your direction
Do not enter unless it is safe
questions.explanation: 'Do Not Enter' means you cannot enter from your direction.

questions.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
options: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway
The posted speed limit for freeway traffic
questions.explanation: You should match the speed of freeway traffic when merging to blend in smoothly and safely.

questions.question: This lane is used to:
options: Pass other vehicles when traffic permits
Make right turns when traffic permits
Begin or end left turns when traffic permits
questions.explanation: Center left-turn lanes are for beginning or ending left turns only.

questions.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:
options: The light is yellow
The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first
You can't get all the way across before the light turns red
questions.explanation: Never enter an intersection unless you can completely clear it before the light turns red.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or more.
options: Five hundredths (0.05) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
One tenth (0.10) of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.

questions.question: When you hear the siren or see the red emergency light of a closely approaching ambulance, police vehicle, or fire truck, you must
options: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop
Move in to the right lane and drive slowly until has passed
Speed up to clear traffic
questions.explanation: Pull to the right edge and stop for emergency vehicles.

questions.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing in the middle of the block ahead:
options: Stop and give the pedestrian the right-of-way
Slow down as you pass him or her
You have the right-of-way, but must take care for his/her safety
questions.explanation: Pedestrians always have the right-of-way, even outside of marked crosswalks. You must stop and let them cross safely.

questions.question: If you have a conditional driver license, there is (are):
options: A special time limit to renew your license
Special restrictions you must follow when driving
Age limits imposed on your driver license
questions.explanation: Conditional licenses have specific restrictions that must be followed.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The traffic signal ahead is not working
Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing
There is a traffic signal ahead
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to stop if the light is red.

questions.question: Following distance should increase when you:
options: Follow a small passenger car
Are crowded by a tailgater
Drive slower than the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: When being tailgated, increase following distance to the car ahead so you have more room to stop gradually.

questions.question: What is a safety zone?
options: An empty lane next to the freeway dividers
A space set aside for pedestrians
The median strip on a divided highway
questions.explanation: A safety zone is a marked area set aside for pedestrians, often near streetcar or light rail stops. Vehicles are not permitted to drive through or park in safety zones.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about motorcycles?
options: Motorcycles are small and can easily be seen by drivers
Motorcycles may not share traffic lanes
Motorcycles should be followed at a greater distance
questions.explanation: Give motorcycles extra following distance - they can stop quickly.

questions.question: You sold your vehicle. You must notify ___ within 5 days.
options: Your insurance company
DMV
Your automobile club
questions.explanation: Notify the DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle to avoid liability.

questions.question: Checking traffic behind you:
options: Will help you know if you are being followed by a tailgater
Is not a good idea. You should pay attention to traffic in front of you
Only when you are slowing down
questions.explanation: Check mirrors regularly to be aware of tailgaters and traffic behind you.

questions.question: When both right and left turn signals are flashing at the same time on a moving vehicle, it means
options: It is carrying children to or from school
Let the vehicle have the right-of-way
There may be a hazard or an accident ahead
questions.explanation: Four-way flashers indicate a hazard or slow-moving vehicle.

questions.question: There is a railroad crossing ahead and you can't see if any trains are coming until you're just about to enter the intersection. The speed limit is:
questions.explanation: At an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph within 100 feet of the tracks.

questions.question: Seat belts are not effective:
options: When going over 40 m.p.h.
Seat belts are always effective
At slow speeds
questions.explanation: Seat belts are effective at all speeds and can save lives in crashes.

questions.question: You should never park:
options: Twenty feet from a railroad track
In a space marked with a cross-hatched pattern
In a bike lane
questions.explanation: Never park in crosshatched areas - they are access aisles for disabled parking spaces.

questions.question: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:
options: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle
If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: You should never drive off the paved roadway to pass another vehicle. It's illegal and dangerous.

questions.question: You may open your vehicle's door on the traffic side
options: At any time while parked
To leave but not to enter your vehicle
Only when it is safe
questions.explanation: Only open doors into traffic when safe to do so.

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you make a turn because:
options: They must have a full traffic lane
They always have the right-of-way at intersections
Their smaller size makes them harder to see
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are smaller and harder to see than cars. Always check carefully before turning.

questions.question: Illegal to enter intersection when:
options: Light is yellow
Light flashing yellow
Can't clear before red
questions.explanation: Don't enter if you can't clear it.

questions.question: If you are the first person to stop to give assistance at a collision scene, you should drive to the side of the road:
options: After you have passed the collision scene
Before you reach the collision scene
Next to the collision scene
questions.explanation: Pull over after passing accident scene to avoid causing another accident.

questions.question: You are driving 55 m.p.h. on a two lane road and want to pass the car ahead of you. To pass safely, you need a ___ gap in the oncoming traffic.
options: 5 second
7 second
10 to 12 second
questions.explanation: At 55 mph, you need at least 10-12 seconds to pass safely.

questions.question: If you are riding in a vehicle equipped with a lap belt and also a separate shoulder belt, you are:
options: Only required to use the lap belt
Required to use both the lap and shoulder belts
Only required to use the shoulder belt
questions.explanation: California law requires all available seat belts to be used. Both lap and shoulder belts must be worn for maximum safety.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about slippery road surfaces?
options: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze after open roads
On cold, wet days, shade from buildings or trees can hide spots of ice
The pavement is slippery for the first few minutes after it starts to rain on a hot day afterward
questions.explanation: Shaded areas can hide ice patches on cold days. Also, the pavement is most slippery during the first few minutes of rain as oil and water mix.

questions.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?
options: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane
When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right
When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before making a right turn.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?
options: Trucks are not as maneuverable as passenger vehicles
They do not need more space to stop and start
They do not need more space for turns
questions.explanation: Large trucks need more space and are less maneuverable than cars.

questions.question: Large trucks often travel with a lot of space in front of their vehicle. This extra space is required for:
options: Other drivers to use when merging onto an offramp
The truck driver to use for stopping the vehicle
Other drivers to use when they want to slow down
questions.explanation: Large trucks need extra space in front to stop safely. Never cut in front of a large truck - they need that space for braking.

questions.question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines two feet or more apart:
options: May only be crossed to enter a private driveway
Should be treated like a solid wall and not be crossed
Denote a lane for beginning or ending left-hand turns
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart indicate a barrier. Treat them like a wall - do not cross.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about blind spots?
options: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots
questions.explanation: Always look over the appropriate shoulder to check blind spots before changing lanes.

questions.question: It is against the law to have an open alcoholic beverage container in your vehicle, except
options: On the back seat
In the trunk
In the glove compartment
questions.explanation: Open containers must be in the trunk.

questions.question: When turning left at an intersection, you should:
options: Always make a complete stop before turning
Check cross traffic from both directions before turning
Pull part way into the intersection and edge into cross traffic slowly
questions.explanation: Before turning left, always check for cross traffic from both directions to ensure it's safe to turn.

questions.question: The 'Basic Speed Law' says you should:
options: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
Always drive at the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: The Basic Speed Law requires you to drive at a speed that is reasonable and safe for current conditions, regardless of the posted limit.

questions.question: There is a railroad crossing ahead and you see flashing red lights warning you of a train coming. You must:
options: Stop only if you see a train coming
Slow down before crossing
Stop, then proceed when safe
questions.explanation: Always stop when railroad signals are flashing. Proceed only when signals stop and it's safe.

questions.question: While all of the following are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?
options: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones
Adjusting your outside mirrors
Wearing dark sunglasses while driving at night
questions.explanation: It is illegal in California to wear headphones covering both ears while driving, as it prevents you from hearing emergency vehicles and other important sounds.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is _____ or higher.
options: 0.08% - Eight hundredths of one percent
0.10% - One tenth of one percent
0.05% - Five hundredths of one percent
questions.explanation: In California, it is illegal for drivers 21 and over to drive with a BAC of 0.08% or higher. This is the legal limit for DUI.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is:
options: 15 mph
20 mph
25 mph
questions.explanation: When you cannot see 400 feet down the railroad tracks in both directions, you must slow to 15 mph and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or more.
options: Five hundredths (0.05) of one percent
One tenth (0.10) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.

questions.question: A freeway on ramp is marked with this sign. Which of the following vehicles may use this lane?
options: A convertible with an adult and two children
A carpool van containing only the driver
A sport utility vehicle containing an adult, child, and family pet
questions.explanation: Carpool lanes (HOV lanes) can only be used if you have the minimum number of occupants shown on the posted signs. Pets do not count as passengers.

questions.question: Legal U-turn:
options: Highway at designated opening
150 feet before curve
In front of fire station
questions.explanation: U-turns legal at designated openings.

questions.question: Should you always drive slower than other traffic?
options: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly
Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique
Yes, it is always safer than driving faster
questions.explanation: Driving significantly slower than traffic flow can be dangerous and cause congestion. Drive at a safe speed that matches traffic conditions.

questions.question: When parking on a hill on a two-way street with no curb, you should:
options: Turn your front wheels to the left, away from the side of the road
Park at a slight angle—rear wheels closer to the road's edge
Turn your front wheels to the right, toward the side of the road
questions.explanation: When parking on a hill with no curb, turn wheels toward the road's edge so the car will roll away from traffic if it moves.

questions.question: California's Basic Speed Law says:
options: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits
You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways
questions.explanation: California's Basic Speed Law means you must never drive faster than is safe for current conditions, regardless of the posted speed limit.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: You cannot turn left
You cannot make a U-turn
You cannot enter the side road
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns.

questions.question: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:
options: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light
Under any circumstances, even if your light is green
Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light
questions.explanation: You must never block an intersection, even if you have a green light. Wait until traffic clears and you can completely cross the intersection.

questions.question: You must make a full stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
options: You don't have room to completely cross the tracks
The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic
There are no warning signals or gates at the crossing
questions.explanation: Never stop on railroad tracks. Only cross if you have enough space to completely clear the tracks on the other side.

questions.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
options: In both directions may pass
Next to the broken line may pass
Next to the solid line may pass
questions.explanation: When there is a solid yellow line on your side, you cannot pass. Only vehicles on the side with the broken line may pass when safe.

questions.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
options: So they face straight ahead
Right - towards the side of the road
Left - towards the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking uphill with no curb, turn wheels to the right. If the vehicle rolls, it will go off the road rather than into traffic.

questions.question: Bicycle riders must
options: Ride facing traffic when there is no bike lane
Be given a safe amount of space when being passed by automobile drivers
never walk the bicycle across the street
questions.explanation: Drivers must give cyclists safe passing space.

questions.question: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?
options: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down
Drive to the right edge of the road and stop
Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass
questions.explanation: When an emergency vehicle approaches with lights and/or sirens, pull to the right edge of the road and stop until it passes.

questions.question: California's 'basic speed law' says, in addition to obeying the maximum speed limit, drivers must keep in mind
options: The posted speed limit
Synchronized stop lights
Road, traffic and weather conditions
questions.explanation: Basic speed law requires adjusting speed for conditions.

questions.question: When can you drive using only your parking lights?
options: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise
Not under any circumstances
On foggy days
questions.explanation: Parking lights are never sufficient for driving. Use headlights from sunset to sunrise.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Drive to the right
Change lanes to the right
Stay in the right lane
questions.explanation: This sign indicates you must keep to the right of a divider or obstruction ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: The road curves to the left
You cannot make a left turn
Left turn permitted on green arrow only
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits left turns. You must go straight or turn right.

questions.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:
options: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible
Always slow down to let the vehicles merge
Maintain your speed and position
questions.explanation: Be courteous and make room for merging traffic when safe. Change lanes or adjust speed if possible to allow smooth merging.

questions.question: You are driving a slow moving vehicle on a winding two-lane highway. You must pull over when it is safe and let other drivers pass when you are followed by
options: 3 vehicles
4 vehicles
5 or more vehicles
questions.explanation: Pull over to let traffic pass if 5 or more vehicles are following you.

questions.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:
options: The light is yellow
The light is flashing yellow
You can't get all the way across before it turns red
questions.explanation: Never enter unless you can completely clear the intersection.

questions.question: Seat belts are not effective:
options: When going over 40 mph
Seat belts are always effective
At slow speeds
questions.explanation: Seat belts are effective at all speeds.

questions.question: Scanning while you drive means you:
options: Keep your eyes moving and look at everything
Stare at the car immediately ahead of you
Look as far ahead as you can see
questions.explanation: Scanning means keeping your eyes moving to check mirrors, watch for hazards, and maintain awareness of your surroundings in all directions.

questions.question: When you enter a freeway from an on ramp and merge with traffic, you should be driving at
options: The legal speed limit on the freeway
About the same speed as the freeway traffic
About 10 m.p.h. slower than the freeway speed limit
questions.explanation: Match freeway traffic speed when merging from on-ramp.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway. Your tire suddenly goes flat and you need to pull over and get help. Where should you pull over?
options: In the right-hand lane
Wherever your car will be visible for 200 feet from the front
Off the pavement
questions.explanation: Pull completely off the pavement for safety when you have vehicle trouble.

questions.question: If you have a conditional driver license, there is (are):
options: A special time limit to renew your license
Special restrictions you must follow when driving
Age limits imposed on your driver license
questions.explanation: Conditional licenses have specific driving restrictions you must follow.

questions.question: You are stopped at an intersection. The traffic light just turned green. Can you go immediately?
options: Yes, other traffic or pedestrians must yield to you
Yes, but yield to any vehicle or person still in the intersection
Yes, you now have the right-of-way
questions.explanation: Even with a green light, you must yield to vehicles and pedestrians still in the intersection before proceeding.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should:
options: Follow closely in bad weather so the driver can see farther ahead
Drive farther behind the truck than for a passenger car
Drive to the right side of the truck and wait to pass
questions.explanation: Large trucks require more following distance. Stay farther back to maintain visibility and give yourself more time to react.

questions.question: You should increase the distance between your car and the vehicle ahead when you:
options: Follow a small passenger car
Are crowded by a tailgater
Drive slower than the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: If someone is tailgating you, increase your following distance to the car ahead so you have more room to stop gradually.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
options: Stopping or parking is not allowed (except buses)
Parking is for disabled persons only
Parking is for emergency vehicles only
questions.explanation: Red curbs prohibit stopping or parking (buses may stop at marked stops).

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or more.
options: Five hundredths (0.05) of one percent
One tenth (0.10) of one percent
Eight hundredths (0.08) of one percent
questions.explanation: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is 0.08%.

questions.question: If drivers want to see cars in their blind spots, they should check:
options: The inside rearview mirror
The outside rearview mirror
Over their shoulders
questions.explanation: Mirrors cannot show your entire blind spot. You must physically turn and look over your shoulder before changing lanes.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Stop every time
Stop two feet before the limit line
Stop only if other vehicles are present
questions.explanation: STOP signs require a complete stop every time, regardless of traffic.

questions.question: The intersection has a stop sign. Where should you first stop?
options: At the crosswalk or limit line
After the crosswalk
Out far enough to see cross traffic
questions.explanation: You must stop at the marked stop line or crosswalk. If there's no marked stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection where you have a clear view of traffic.

questions.question: Should you always drive slower than other traffic?
options: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly
Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique
Yes, it is always safer than driving faster
questions.explanation: Driving significantly slower than traffic flow can be dangerous and cause congestion. Drive at a safe speed that matches traffic conditions.

questions.question: Which of these is a legal U-turn?
options: On a highway at a designated opening
150 feet before a curve
In front of a fire station
questions.explanation: U-turns are legal on highways at designated openings.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking drugs?
options: Most drugs taken for headaches or colds can make a person drowsy
Drugs and alcohol can be used at the same time
Prescription drugs are safe at any time
questions.explanation: Many common medications can cause drowsiness and impair driving.

questions.question: You can drive in a carpool lane if:
options: You are driving an empty 15 passenger van
Want to pass the vehicle ahead
Have the minimum number of passengers shown on the sign
questions.explanation: Carpool lanes (HOV lanes) can only be used if you have the minimum number of occupants shown on the posted signs, typically 2 or 3 people.

questions.question: The 'implied consent law' means you have given consent:
options: To vehicle inspection for alcohol
To be tested for alcohol in your blood
For a field sobriety test
questions.explanation: By driving, you consent to BAC testing if suspected of DUI.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:
options: Slow down before entering
Stop before entering
Stop and wait for the green light
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means the same as a stop sign. Stop completely, yield to traffic and pedestrians, then proceed when safe.

questions.question: A curb painted blue means:
options: Loading or unloading passengers only
Parking for a limited time
Parking for disabled person with placard
questions.explanation: Blue curbs are for disabled parking only.

questions.question: Sleeping pills, tranquilizers, pain medicine, or cold or allergy medications
options: May impair your driving
May increase the bad effects of alcohol on your driving
Both of the above
questions.explanation: These medications can impair driving and worsen alcohol effects.

questions.question: A driver unexpectedly changes lanes in front of you. The California Driver Handbook recommends:
options: Quickly moving into the lane next to you
Driving onto the shoulder of the road
Taking your foot off the gas pedal
questions.explanation: When another driver cuts in front of you, take your foot off the gas to slow down and increase following distance. Avoid sudden swerving.

questions.question: When can you merge into a bike lane for a right turn?
options: Under no circumstances
No more than 100 feet before turning
No more than 200 feet before turning
questions.explanation: You may enter a bike lane no more than 200 feet before turning right.

questions.question: When can you cross a solid double yellow line to pass another vehicle?
options: When you know there are no cars coming towards you
When a slow moving vehicle refuses to use a turn-out lane
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: Never cross double solid yellow lines to pass. They mark areas where passing is prohibited.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about motorcycles?
options: Motorcycles are small and can easily be seen by drivers
Motorcycles may not share traffic lanes
Motorcycles should be followed at a greater distance
questions.explanation: Give motorcycles extra following distance. They can stop more quickly than cars and need space.

questions.question: This sign means:
options: Fewer lanes ahead
Divided highway ahead
Crossroad intersects the main road
questions.explanation: This sign warns that you are approaching a divided highway. The road ahead is split by a median or divider.

questions.question: When you reach a corner without a traffic light or sign at the same time as vehicles on the cross street, you must yield the right-of-way to
options: The driver on your right
The driver on your left
Neither driver
questions.explanation: At unmarked intersections, yield to traffic on your right.

questions.question: You want to park downhill and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
options: Parallel to the road
Away from the side of the road
Towards the side of the road
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the side when parking downhill without a curb.

questions.question: You must look for bicycle riders in the same lanes used by motor vehicles because they:
options: Must ride facing oncoming traffic
Usually have the right-of-way
Are entitled to share the road with you
questions.explanation: Bicyclists have the same rights to use roadways as motor vehicles and are entitled to share the road.

questions.question: When you come to a corner where there is a flashing yellow light you must
options: Stop before crossing
Wait for the green light
Slow down and cross carefully
questions.explanation: Flashing yellow means proceed with caution.

questions.question: If you have a conditional driver license, there is (are):
options: A special time limit to renew your license
Special restrictions you must follow when driving
Age limits imposed on your driver license
questions.explanation: Conditional licenses have specific restrictions you must follow.

questions.question: Driving so slowly as to interfere with normal or reasonable flow of traffic, except when necessary for safety, is
options: A violation of the law
The right of any driver
Legal, but not advisable
questions.explanation: Impeding traffic flow is a violation unless necessary for safety.

questions.question: You should never park:
options: Twenty feet from a railroad track
In a space marked with a cross-hatched pattern
In a bike lane
questions.explanation: Never park in crosshatched areas - they're access aisles for disabled spaces.

questions.question: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?
options: The driver on your left has the right-of-way
You have the right-of-way
Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, when two vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way. Since the other driver is on your left, you have the right-of-way.

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a residential district is:
options: 20 mph
25 mph
30 mph
questions.explanation: The speed limit in residential districts is 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: You are going to make a right turn from a dedicated right-turn lane when a yellow arrow appears for your lane. You should:
options: Be prepared to obey the next signal that appears
Check for pedestrians and then turn with caution
Stop and not make the turn under any circumstances
questions.explanation: A yellow arrow means the signal is about to change. Check for pedestrians and complete your turn with caution if safe.

questions.question: You reach the intersection at the same time as the driver on your left. Who goes first?
options: The driver on your left goes first
You go first
Whoever is signaling to make a turn
questions.explanation: When two vehicles arrive at an uncontrolled intersection simultaneously, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Where a left turn at an intersection can be started from either of two lanes, a U-turn can be started from
options: Either of the two lanes
Only the left lane
Any lane that is open
questions.explanation: U-turns must be started from the left lane only.

questions.question: You are driving on a two-way street and you want to turn left at the corner. Give the right-of-way to:
options: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a 'WALK' signal
Any vehicle coming towards you
Vehicles stopped at a red light
questions.explanation: When turning left, yield to all oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: The 'implied consent law' says you have agreed to take a test for the alcohol content of your blood
options: Whenever you drive in California
On advice of an attorney
If an accident has occurred
questions.explanation: By driving in California, you consent to BAC testing.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident and there is more than $500 in damages. You must:
options: Show evidence that you have insurance only to a peace officer
Make a written report (SR 1) to the DMV
Make a written report (SR 1) to the CHP only if anyone is injured or killed
questions.explanation: File an SR-1 report with DMV for accidents with injury, death, or over $500 damage.

questions.question: Why should your passengers wear a seat belt?
options: It's the law
It helps prevent accidents
Passengers are not required to wear seat belts
questions.explanation: California law requires all vehicle occupants to wear seat belts.

questions.question: What is a safety zone?
options: An empty lane next to the freeway dividers
The median strip on a divided highway
A space set aside for pedestrians
questions.explanation: Safety zones are marked areas for pedestrians, usually at transit stops.

questions.question: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:
options: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle
If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: Never drive off paved roadway to pass - it's illegal and dangerous.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is:
options: 15 mph
20 mph
25 mph
questions.explanation: Speed limit is 15 mph at railroad crossings with limited visibility.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street.
options: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street
Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb
One of your rear wheels must touch the curb
questions.explanation: Wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb when parallel parking.

questions.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
options: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
5 to 10 mph slower than the traffic on the freeway
The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway
questions.explanation: Match the speed of freeway traffic when merging for safety.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
options: Fog lights only
High beams
Low beams
questions.explanation: Use low beams in fog - high beams reflect back and reduce visibility.

questions.question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ___ days.
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You should:
options: Stop, then proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus
Slow to 25 mph and pass cautiously
Stop as long as the red lights are flashing
questions.explanation: Must stop while school bus lights are flashing red.

questions.question: [IMAGE: SLOWER TRAFFIC KEEP RIGHT sign] This sign means:
options: Always drive in the right lane
Slower traffic has the right-of-way
Drive in the right lane if you are driving slower than traffic
questions.explanation: Slower vehicles should keep right to allow faster traffic to pass.

questions.question: [IMAGE: LEFT TURN YIELD ON GREEN sign] This sign means:
options: You may turn right when the light is green
You may turn left on a green light when it is safe
You may turn left when the light is green
questions.explanation: You can turn left on green, but must yield to oncoming traffic.

questions.question: When waiting to make a left turn, you should give the right-of-way to vehicles coming from the opposite direction:
options: Until at least two vehicles have passed
Until dangerously close cars have passed
Until all of the cars have passed
questions.explanation: Yield to oncoming traffic that is dangerously close when turning left.

questions.question: California's 'Basic Speed Law' says:
options: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits
You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways
questions.explanation: Basic Speed Law requires driving at safe speed for conditions.

questions.question: A white painted curb means:
options: Loading zone for freight or passengers
Loading zone for passengers or mail only
Loading zone for freight only
questions.explanation: White curbs are for passenger and mail loading only.

questions.question: You are about to make a left turn. You must signal continuously during the last ____ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?
options: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle
Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles
Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rear view mirrors
questions.explanation: Large trucks have much larger blind spots than passenger vehicles.

questions.question: You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
options: Leave a note on the vehicle
Report the accident without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the CHP
Both of the above
questions.explanation: Leave a note and report to police when hitting parked vehicle.

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted the speed limit in a residential area is ____.
options: 20 mph
25 mph
30 mph
questions.explanation: Default residential speed limit is 25 mph unless posted otherwise.

questions.question: If you sell your vehicle, you must notify ______ within five days.
options: Your automobile club
The DMV
Your insurance company
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling your vehicle.

questions.question: [IMAGE: NO U-TURN sign] This sign means:
options: Left lane ends
No U-turn
You must turn left
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns at this location.

questions.question: [IMAGE: STOP sign] This sign means:
options: Stop
Stop only if other vehicles are present
Stop 10 feet behind the stop line
questions.explanation: STOP sign requires complete stop every time.

questions.question: The very first effect of even a small amount of alcohol on a person's safe driving ability is to reduce his or her:
options: Steering ability
Good judgment
Muscle control
questions.explanation: Alcohol first impairs judgment before physical abilities.

questions.question: You may legally block an intersection:
options: When you entered the intersection on the green light
During rush hour traffic
Under no circumstances
questions.explanation: Never block an intersection under any circumstances.

questions.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:
options: Turned to the left (toward the street)
Turned to the right (away from the street)
Parallel with the pavement
questions.explanation: Turn wheels right (away from street) when parking uphill without curb.

questions.question: [IMAGE: Merge arrow sign] This sign means:
options: Another lane is merging with your lane
You have the right-of-way
Side road ahead
questions.explanation: This sign warns that another lane is merging with yours.

questions.question: [IMAGE: No right turn sign] This sign means:
options: Right lane ends here
Side road to the right
No right turn
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns.

questions.question: [IMAGE: Cross road sign] This sign means:
options: Another lane is merging with yours
Another road crosses yours
Side road ahead on the right
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a cross road or intersection ahead.

questions.question: You must turn on your headlights _____ minutes after sunset and leave them on until _____ minutes before sunrise.
questions.explanation: Turn on headlights 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise.

questions.question: What is a safety zone?
options: An empty space next to the freeway dividers
A space set aside for pedestrians
The median strip on a divided highway
questions.explanation: Safety zones are marked areas for pedestrians, typically at transit stops.

questions.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
options: Any lane (as long as it is safe)
The lane closest to the left curb
The lane in the center of the road
questions.explanation: Turn left from the far left lane on one-way streets.

questions.question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report (SR1) to the DMV:
options: Only if you or the other driver is injured
If there is property damage in excess of $750 or if there are any injuries
Only if you are at fault
questions.explanation: File SR-1 if damage exceeds $750 or anyone is injured.

questions.question: Roadways are the most slippery:
options: During a heavy downpour
After it has been raining for awhile
The first rain after a dry spell
questions.explanation: First rain after dry spell makes roads most slippery due to oil buildup.

questions.question: You may not park your vehicle:
options: On the side of the freeway in an emergency
Next to a red painted curb
Within 100 feet of an elementary school
questions.explanation: Never park next to a red curb - it's a no-stopping zone.

questions.question: [IMAGE: REST AREA 1 MILE sign] This sign means:
options: The right lane is ending
A rest area is ahead
A restricted area is ahead
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a rest area is 1 mile ahead.

questions.question: [IMAGE: YIELD sign] This sign means:
options: Vehicles on the right have the right-of-way
You have the right-of-way
Give the right-of-way to cross traffic
questions.explanation: YIELD sign means give right-of-way to cross traffic.

questions.question: The 'three-second rule' applies to the space _________ of your vehicle.
options: to the sides
ahead
in back
questions.explanation: Three-second rule applies to following distance ahead of vehicle.

questions.question: [IMAGE: Right curve sign] This sign means:
options: Right curve ahead
No right turn allowed
Right turn allowed on green arrow
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a curve to the right ahead.

questions.question: What should you do if an oncoming car at night approaches with its high-beams on?
options: Flash your high-beams quickly at the other driver
Slow down and look straight ahead
Look toward the right edge of your lane
questions.explanation: Look toward right edge of lane to avoid being blinded by high beams.

questions.question: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:
options: Move toward the left side of your lane
Avoid driving in the bicycle lane
Signal for 100 feet before turning
questions.explanation: Signal at least 100 feet before turning.

questions.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 mph. The traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:
options: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph
questions.explanation: Never exceed posted speed limit, even if traffic is going faster.

questions.question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines two feet or more apart:
options: May only be crossed to enter a private driveway
Should be treated like a solid wall and not be crossed
Denote a lane for beginning or ending left-hand turns
questions.explanation: Double yellow lines 2+ feet apart are a barrier - do not cross.

questions.question: You must notify the DMV within 5 days if you:
options: Sell or transfer your vehicle
Fail a smog test for your vehicle
Get a new prescription for lenses or contacts
questions.explanation: Notify DMV within 5 days of selling or transferring vehicle.

questions.question: When planning to pass other vehicles, you should:
options: Not assume they will make space for you to return to your lane
Assume they will let you pass if you use your turn signal
Assume they will maintain a constant speed
questions.explanation: Never assume other drivers will make space when passing.

questions.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 mph. The traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:
options: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph
questions.explanation: Never exceed posted speed limit regardless of traffic flow.

questions.question: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction and continually pass the other cars, you will:
options: Get you to your destination much faster and safer
Increase your chances of an accident
Help prevent traffic congestion
questions.explanation: Continually passing increases accident risk significantly.

questions.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if:
options: A sign permits the turn
Traffic on the street moves to the right
Traffic on the street moves to the left
questions.explanation: Can only turn left onto one-way if traffic moves left.

questions.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:
options: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes
May have to swing wide to complete the right turn
Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning
questions.explanation: Large trucks need to swing wide to complete right turns safely.

questions.question: You may cross a double, yellow line to pass another vehicle, if the yellow line next to:
options: The other side of the road is a broken line
Your side of the road is a broken line
The other side of the road is a broken line
questions.explanation: Can cross if the line on YOUR side is broken.

questions.question: Before changing lanes, you must:
options: See if it is safe before making the move
Flash your high-beam headlights
Drive faster than other traffic
questions.explanation: Always check if safe before changing lanes.

questions.question: [IMAGE: KEEP RIGHT sign] This sign means:
options: Change lanes to the right
Drive to the right
Slower traffic should move to the right
questions.explanation: This sign directs you to keep to the right side.

questions.question: [IMAGE: WRONG WAY sign] This sign means:
options: Do not enter the road ahead unless it is safe
The road ahead is closed to all traffic
The road ahead is closed to traffic in your direction
questions.explanation: WRONG WAY sign means you're going the wrong direction.

questions.question: When driving near a road construction zone, you should:
options: Pass the construction zone carefully and avoid rubbernecking
Step on your brakes just before you pass the construction zone
Slow down to watch the construction as you pass
questions.explanation: Pass construction zones carefully without rubbernecking.
